7114f70daec5.title: Quite a moving tale and article, David.

content.subtitle: I have much in common with the old lady in your story. And I too am unsure if I will ever again see or hear from my offspring. Both my…

virtuals.subtitle: I have much in common with the old lady in your story. And I too am unsure if I will ever again see or hear from my offspring. Both my…

paragraphs.text: Quite a moving tale and article, David. I wept quietly as I read it, most especially because I was so touched by the depth of your compassion, and by the wisdom within your insights. Your chronological youth is offset by the beautiful old soul within you.
paragraphs.name: ff8f

211d23721df9.title: Thank you once again for another kind comment, Joanne.

content.subtitle: Thank you too for sharing your own personal suffering with your children. It moved my heart very much. There are no words to express the…

paragraphs.text: Thank you once again for another kind comment, Joanne.
paragraphs.name: 540d

paragraphs.text: Thank you too for sharing your own personal suffering with your children. It moved my heart very much. There are no words to express the pain that such suffering brings. And it’s one that’s hard to fully understand, but I wanted to write this piece to show that even in…
paragraphs.name: e3af

556cef8657ab.title: We’ve become such human doings as opposed to human beings.

paragraphs.text: We’ve become such human doings as opposed to human beings. You alluded to it; that moment when you felt the conversation was over and the need to get on with the rest of your day with whatever you were doing. The fact you were able to BE for this person, however, made all the difference, to your day and hers.
paragraphs.name: 03c4

paragraphs.text: Thank you for the comment. I agree that each friendship is so unique, and it’s so amazing when we can discover that beauty in each person’s heart. Also, when we befriend someone, it’s not just us who gives, but we receive so much too.
paragraphs.name: 046a

c80e3089663d.title: David Lorenzo — yes we can be a friend.

paragraphs.text: David Lorenzo — yes we can be a friend. And all the wonderful things friendship does and gives. And how you found meaning in your life. I do wonder if she saw a mirror of her son in you?

5242f5f1f2a2.title: Exactly! In terms of crisis, the most important thing someone can do sometimes is to truly listen…

paragraphs.text: Exactly! In terms of crisis, the most important thing someone can do sometimes is to truly listen and be in the moment with them. When someone truly listens I beileve the pain literally gets shared and thus lightens the load of the sharer.
paragraphs.name: 78c7

73966ecdbfd3.title: To the author of this piece: Thank you for existing!

paragraphs.text: To the author of this piece: Thank you for existing! What you did for the hurting lady (selfless kindness which I will try to emulate-really hard to do nowadays) is both inspiring and heartwarming.
paragraphs.name: 3ede

content.subtitle: But at the same time, when times of crises strike, often the beauty and goodness of the human heart arises. People’s lives are changed…

virtuals.subtitle: But at the same time, when times of crises strike, often the beauty and goodness of the human heart arises. People’s lives are changed…

paragraphs.text: Hey, Jennifer Thibault. Thank you for the comments and for sharing your piece. I totally agree that suffering can help us be better people if we deal with it in the right way. It’s a mystery (one of the biggest of life). On the one hand, all the natural disasters, sicknesses, wars, poverty, and interior traumas, etc. appall us. How can we even…
paragraphs.name: 0c1d

paragraphs.text: Thank you !
paragraphs.name: acbe

6aef442f43b2.title: People come to me too when they seek friendship, and honestly, these friendships are truly a bunch…

paragraphs.text: People come to me too when they seek friendship, and honestly, these friendships are truly a bunch of odds and ends: each person I meet and befriend is unique. And yes, I truly agree that friendship is perhaps the best thing you can give to a person. :-)
paragraphs.name: 3f6f

paragraphs.text: Yes we have. We’re often thinking about the next thing on our to-do list before we even finish with what were currently doing, and because of that we can miss moments that can impact our lives. It’s a struggle to pause and focus on the present moment, but we need to do so to preserve who we are: Human beings. Thank you.
paragraphs.name: 8d78

da745929c91.title: Thank you for this thoughtful post.

content.subtitle: Without suffering, you might lose a distant acquaintance reaching out from halfway around the world to say ‘I understand and I’m sorry,’ a…

virtuals.subtitle: Without suffering, you might lose a distant acquaintance reaching out from halfway around the world to say ‘I understand and I’m sorry,’ a…

paragraphs.text: Thank you for this thoughtful post. I wrote something a few weeks back about suffering that seems to be speak to a similar thing. “At BC, I took a Buddhism class and it taught me that “suffering is the thing that connects us all.” I understood it in theory, but hardly in practice. My life was one unmarred by loss, betrayel, accusation, difficulty…

9b27fe74d8af89fe9bfd4eb4f8edf356.title: You See, All I Need Is a True Friend

paragraphs.text: But can we really live like that? Accepting suffering as some kind of fact of life? Just walking by when we see suffering incarnated in flesh and blood? Do we really see the human being behind the suffering, or rather, the human who is suffering?
paragraphs.name: 836a

paragraphs.text: Now, I didn’t say anything wise. I didn’t say anything that fixed her problem or that gave her a concrete solution, but I was there for her and, in the end, that seemed to make the difference.
paragraphs.name: 1da4

paragraphs.text: But there are problems that the internet, technology, and money cannot solve.
paragraphs.name: 76ec
